website_summaries.verdict: Taos Top Stars contain a lot of elements that, when combined together, make these “top” kicks. The soft canvas uppers are amazingly detailed, the removable footbeds are arch supportive, and the soles are light and flexible. The shoes are well-ventilated to keep you in fine form even when you’ve been on your feet for a long time. And the styling is unique and most definitely beautiful.
pros: Most users agree that Taos Top Stars are pretty comfy shoes that you can wear all day
Many were pleasantly surprised about the arch support found in the sneakers’ removable footbeds
Several purchasers stated that these kicks from Taos’ high-top collection are true to size
Taos Top Star sneakers are hip little things that will rake you a lot of compliments, according to plenty of consumers
The shoes have a soft, lightweight canvas that feels great for most kinds of weather, some stated
Taos Top Stars are built with the same high-quality that Taos footwear is known for, a few noted
A handful of buyers liked the shoes so much that they bought more pairs in different colors
Two testers were pleased with the flexible soles of these kicks
The sneakers breathe well and don’t make the feet sweaty, a customer reported
cons: Taos Top Star footwear are tricky to put on or off, several users stated
A few people reported that the shoes need more cushioning on the heel part

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love but painful spot in heel made me return
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of Taos Stars that I LOVE and was really hoping to love these too. They're very cute, and one foot was very comfortable while the other foot had this weird spot in the fabric of the heel that was hard and poked out. It was excruciating after 20 minutes and didn't feel like the kind of thing that would ever break in. It was only in the one foot and felt like a defect. Had that not been there I would've kept them for sure and probably given them at least 4 stars. Maybe you'll get more lucky than I did. And yes I paid full price for them!
customer_reviews.author: Kate MahoneyTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Five plus stars!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are the most comfortable tennis style shoe I have ever owned. I hesitated because of the price, but so glad I bought them. I did follow previous review recommendations and went up half a size. I usually get a 7, but got 7.5 and fits perfect! I highly recommendation buying these, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jill W.

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: Who would look at these shoes and think they would be great for people with troublesome feet and low back pain? Well they are! I wear them regularly and am always surprised at how good my feet feel in them. I love that they have a little more of a today style rather than an old timer I sometimes feel I’m getting to be (I’m not quite there). If you have the issues I spoke of you can’t go wrong with these shoes. If you don’t like the insoles you can remove them and put in your own. I highly recommend this shoe!!
customer_reviews.author: R. Rowan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: First time Taos brand shoe buyer here. I wear a size 8 in closed toe shoes. I bought a size 8 and they are perfect! I am size 7 or 7.5 in flip flops and such. So when others say to size up half a size maybe that's what they are thinking of, how feet fit differently in different shoes. These are so comfortable! I bought them in black. Love the look, love the feel. Impressed so far! For the life of me I can not figure out why my phone is posting my photos upside down and sideways. Hope they help though!
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Not the Taos for me.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these hightop Taos hoping to replace my high-top Vans, which I love but kill my feet. These are a sub-par replacement when compared with the Vans. The stitching was wonky, the fit was uncomfortable, and the shoe was ugly. I like the support of the Taos footbed, but there was an odd tightness around my toe area and it caused my foot to feel "asleep". I did go up 1/2 size, which was definitely needed. I ended up buying a Footpro insert for my Vans and returned these shoes. However, I did have great luck with the Taos Moc Star, and I certainly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again! Goodbye orthotics
customer_reviews.text: I'm a true size 9, and I ordered a 9 in graphite distressed - at first I thought it was a bit tight in the toe area, but keep with it! Canvas shoes often need some time to break in and I'm so glad I kept my true size. They fit perfectly and the insole is really comfortable with plantar fasciitis. I knocked off one star because it did rip on the little part of material that the shoe laces go through on the front but it doesn't affect anything.
customer_reviews.author: CourtF

customer_reviews.title: Order a size up and they're great!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoes, even for wearing a full day on the feet right out of the box! As other reviewers mentioned, a full size up on the sizing is preferable. I ordered one pair in my regular size and one a full size up and the full size up feels right. So their sizing is a bit off, but they're great shoes.
customer_reviews.author: LIsa Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Size 8 fits like 7.5
customer_reviews.text: I have started wearing size 8 for a looser fit in shoes. My foot actually is a 7.5 and this shoe as an 8 is more of a 7.5 fit. Most 8 literally wobble on my foot, which I prefer for adding inserts or thicker socks, if either are needed. These are very comfortable 8s but no extra space whatsoever. Oddly the footbed and arch have perfect placement making these shoes uber comfortable and I love the burgundy color.
customer_reviews.author: Jaeleigh

customer_reviews.title: Very cool and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are sooooo sexy!! Because of other reviews, I did order a half size up, HOWEVER, they’re cozily big now. I haven't yet felt the little toe rub thing others are talking about. So I should have just gotten my normal size. These are super cute. UPDATE: I did start feeling the little toes squishing after walking more in them. Now it's down to 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Cool shoes
customer_reviews.text: Not only are these cool looking and comfortable, but they're great for just spending the day tooling around. I have special inserts, so I was able to remove the footbed and place the inserts easily into these shoes. I like the higher profile of a "mid-top" They're not cheap... but my hope is they hold up well and I get my $$$ out of them. :)
customer_reviews.author: RRR

customer_reviews.title: needed these
customer_reviews.text: love Taos shoe brand I had surgery a few yrs ago and these have been the best arch support I stand for a living and im able to stand with out my foot swelling. I have 3 pair and love them all. this pair does rub my little toe so somewhere in this high top style is a little more narrow but I do love them
customer_reviews.author: jamie

customer_reviews.title: Great arch support, very comfortable, runs small
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say enough good things about these shoes. I love them so much I have bought 4 other pairs in different styles. I use them for everything, even light hiking. I have high arches and need good support, these keep my feet from hurting even through a 14- hour work day! Be aware that the canvas ones run small so you'll need to size up. I normally wear a 9-9.5 and ordered a 9.5 but could probably have gone with a 10 which would allow for thicker socks. For some reason the leather Taos I've ordered are fine in a 9.5
customer_reviews.author: Taylor G

customer_reviews.title: Love these sneakers!
customer_reviews.text: These sneakers are very comfortable. I use to have heel pain but have not had any with these sneakers. I can wear them all day with no foot pain. These work well for me and they look good too!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Nice take on a high top sneaker
customer_reviews.text: These are a nice change up on a canvas sneaker. They are a little difficult to get on. I would recomend going up at least a half size I normally wear a size 10, I went up to a size 10.5 here. They have a pretty good supportive insole that is removable if you want to use your own orthodic. Liked these enough to own a tan pair and a gray pair.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Janet

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic arch support!
customer_reviews.text: If you need a super cute casual shoe with great arch support, then this is it. I have plantar fasciitis and it's impossible to find cute shoes with enough support. I am so happy to have found this shoe. I usually wear a 7/7.5 but I needed an 8.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Quality of shoe! Sewed wrong as in picture
customer_reviews.text: Love this shoe sent first one back for same issue fabric on tongue sewed wrong causing it to fray. Second pair worse than first would like a pair that is made right!
customer_reviews.author: SUE D.

customer_reviews.title: Can't Seem to Buy Enough
customer_reviews.text: The women in family rave ab out these. My wife works retail and my youngest daughter works in a grocery. They wear them out. They call them 10 hour shoes. They look great and if you have to be on your feet "they are the bomb".
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are NOT comfortable!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting this shoe to be extremely comfortable, it is not. The arch support is sufficient, but the canvas is rough on the interior of the shoe, and even with supportive, thick socks it rubs blisters on both my little toes. I can buy shoes that fit this poorly at Payless. Taos is over rated and way over priced.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Beard

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes!
customer_reviews.text: The arch in these shoes feels weird at first, then I took them off...and couldn't wait to put them back on! They are so comfortable. I bought these for work (on my feet all day as a physical therapist) but then bought another pair for running around the city - they look great with so many outfits. I'd buy every color- and just might at this rate!
customer_reviews.author: Meghan485

customer_reviews.title: Taos does it yet again! Happy camper.
customer_reviews.text: Runs a half size small just like their regular sneaker. Quality is like what I expected. I have several taos shoes ranging from flats & boots. Their quality is top notch as always.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Flores

customer_reviews.title: Good delivery
customer_reviews.text: So - they are too big - but I never return anything - I figure in about 5 years my feet will get bigger - at least that’s what they say as you get older :)
customer_reviews.author: Mikasa Barton

customer_reviews.title: I thought this would have a thicker almost richer texture.
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would be a different texture, not what I was expecting. I was expecting something a bit more sturdier especially for the price that I paid, at least this color was true though. Really was excited to see these, then I opened them ... they are pretty pricey to be made like this. Then again, things were made better back in the day ...
customer_reviews.author: Phyde

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to put on without a shoe horn
customer_reviews.text: Cute shoes, but couldn't get them on without a struggle and a shoe horn. Once on my foot, toe box much too narrow to be comfortable. I ordered a half-size larger than my normal shoe size, as I've learned to do with Taos Footwear. With the difficulty getting on, these would never be worn, even if they were comfortable. I'm surprised Taos created a shoe with so many problems. They've got to be returned.
customer_reviews.author: Janine LaMaie

customer_reviews.title: Definitely half size up!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great. I was stubborn and didn't believe when others suggested a half size up so it just resulted in me having to return the first pair, then order again. Worth it though! Save yourself the time and just order half size up from the start. Super cute, comfortable shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: They are just ok
customer_reviews.text: I like the look of the shoe and fabric but it didn’t feel like it has the support as other taos shoes have. Also I have other Taos tennis shoes and these don’t have as much decorative stitching as others.
customer_reviews.author: K. Kircher

customer_reviews.title: These fit my orthotics well.
customer_reviews.text: I love these Taos hightops. I can wear them all day and my orthotics fit well. I have 3 pair and weAr them almost all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Mackey

customer_reviews.title: Taos is tops in comfort!
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoe. The arch support is very comfortable and I’m looking forward to getting another pair in a different color. Cute with all I’ve tried them with.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy F

customer_reviews.title: Heavenly walks
customer_reviews.text: I love these sneakers. They're stylish and I can wear them with almost any outfit! They're also super comfortable and provide great arch support. Worth the price point!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits to size and extremely comfortable
customer_reviews.text: It's amazing how much the arch support in these shoes makes such a difference. I'm literally an inch taller in these! They are so incredibly comfortable. They are an exact fit to size with no socks so if you would like a little more wiggle room when wearing socks I would suggest getting a half size bigger. Honestly don't see me buying any other brand of shoe in the future. Worth it worth it worth it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jacinta magwood

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: They are not as cute as the picture and so hard to get on and off. They are also quite uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Lcozy

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. My daughter loved them also so I had to order another pair for her. I normally wear a 9 1/2 to a 10 and after reading other reviews of ordering a size up I decided that’s what I would Do also and they fit just right. Love these shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda M

customer_reviews.title: No support
customer_reviews.text: For the cost of the shoe, no support. No arch support and barely any support. The shoe is made cheap. Not impressed. Don’t waste your money. Wore them a few times. Last time wore on black Friday shopping and after 4 hours it was rubbing against my small toe and feet were aching.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very cute
customer_reviews.text: Love the look of these. Ordered the blue. They fit great and were comfortable except for one problem that I seem to always have with Taos sneakers....they rub terribly in several places. Tried them for a while, but sadly had to return.
customer_reviews.author: C. D.

customer_reviews.title: Not as great as all the taos sandels I've bought
customer_reviews.text: Love taos products but these were not comfortable to me was hoping for more support
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Good arch support
customer_reviews.text: These Taos sneakers have a very decent arch support. I suffer from plantar fasciitis and I can wear these shoes. They are a bit difficult to get on, best to use a shoe horn. Love the distressed look and the comfort.
customer_reviews.author: imadeadpoet

customer_reviews.title: Love the shoes
customer_reviews.text: Really like the shoe. Good support and I get a lot of compliments.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: More comfy than Converse
customer_reviews.text: I love these cute hightops. I normally slip in a custom orthotic footbed, but no need with these. I have a wide toe bed with one bunion, and they fit perfectly. I usually size up to a size 8.5, but the 8 was best. I got the blue too. Cool distressed look and I wear without socks. Taos is worth the extra cash!
customer_reviews.author: Outdoors gal

customer_reviews.title: Stylish shoe
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. Little tighter than the size usually is. Cool shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: REPEAT CUSTOMER
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. Love everything about them. If more colors come out in the same “washed” look, l will buy.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne Bonnell

customer_reviews.title: Hello Taos, good-bye orthotics
customer_reviews.text: Love my Taos sneaks. These are my 4th pair. Arch support is so good, I don’t have to wear orthotics. I always go up a half size for a more comfortable fit.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie C

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable 😣
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are so cute....but so uncomfortable that I don’t even want to wear them. Being Taos brand, I expected a more comfortable and supportive shoe. They dig into the back of my foot (plenty of room everywhere else). :(
customer_reviews.author: Abbie Conner

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Loved the look but they were very stiff & uncomfortable. Just trying them on showed me I'd probably get a blister on the back of my foot. Real disappointed & had to return them
customer_reviews.author: Deborah M Dephillipo

customer_reviews.title: Run Small
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes but they do run small. Order at least a .5 size up...
customer_reviews.author: A. Fonseca

customer_reviews.title: so comfy
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these shoes, they are so comfortable... i wore them on my honeymoon the entire week and my feet did not hurt at all. With our without socks too! they are perfect and planning to get more.
customer_reviews.author: deltanine77

customer_reviews.title: Ran very small
customer_reviews.text: Very cute, but not comfortable enough for the price. Also ran very small. I usually wear a 9 and I ordered a 9.5 - still too small.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: He's run smaller than my normal size.
customer_reviews.text: I am bummed that I have to return them.... Too small. I have I have several pairs of Taos sandals and order a size 9 but these do not fit. I seriously don't like that I spent so much money on them and now have to return them.
customer_reviews.author: gina ames

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and cute
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves these shoes, look of popular hightops but actual support.
customer_reviews.author: J.Mac

customer_reviews.title: Taos Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I read the reviews and ordered a half size larger. It's perfect. It arrived two days after I ordered it.
customer_reviews.author: Chari Norum

customer_reviews.title: Super comfy!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice arch support. I normally wear a 7.5 or an 8. The 8 fit perfect. Fun style with rolled up or skinny jeans. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: L. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes! So cute!
customer_reviews.text: Go up half a size for sure. These are super supportive and comfy. Haven’t worn them out and about yet but I can tell already my feet will be happy in them. :)
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.T

customer_reviews.title: not a disappointment
customer_reviews.text: it fits! it looks great! glad I broke my "rule" allowing me to purchase shoes without trying them on first.
customer_reviews.author: worker bee

customer_reviews.title: Best ever
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Just hope that its quality lasts long. Everything so far as hoped. Great product and yes I ordered half size bigger and fit is now perfect
customer_reviews.author: Sabeeha

customer_reviews.title: Taos
customer_reviews.text: The comfort is amazing, shoes are very good for walking!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Hilda Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I have had a pair of taos and loved them.. this pair seems the same as last one...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sneakers
customer_reviews.text: Love the look and the arch support!! They seem to run a bit small though.
customer_reviews.author: donna conlon

customer_reviews.title: Go up 1/2 size
customer_reviews.text: I had to go up a half of a size but these are comfortable and fun.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: Safe for Fat/ Flat Feet!
customer_reviews.text: CUTE SHOES!! I have wide feet and they swell in the summer and when I travel for some reason. I normally wear a 9 but they were too small. So I went a size up to a 10 and they are perfect! They're so cute! Because they run small for my fat ass feet, I am plesantly surprised they don't look like clown shoes even though they're a size 10!
customer_reviews.author: tanders123

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable
customer_reviews.text: If they weren't $100 a pair I'd be tempted to buy every color. I love these shoes :)
customer_reviews.author: Abi

customer_reviews.title: These are wonderful ♥
customer_reviews.text: Plantar facetious & heel spurs and I'd given up on having cute shoes ever again. Then I found Taos. I bought a pair of the Crave boots, then the Tall Crave's and I've worn them almost exclusively all winter. Every time I wear them someone compliments me on them. Spring is coming and I want to try the sneakers, the Top Star's are every bit as wonderful as the boots. I listened and went up a 1/2 size and they fit perfectly. Love the high top, nicely made, feel like I could walk forever ♥
customer_reviews.author: Mary

product_meta.title: Taos womens Top Star Tps13668 Brown Size:
product_meta.description: Top Star is a new take on sneakers because it is just what you need for all day, everyday adventures. Lacing delivers a custom fit. Remarkable comfort comes from the Curves & Pods premium removable footbed, one of the most comfortable footbeds you’re ever likely to wear.
feature_bullets: *Fit Tip: Customer feedback suggests to order a half size larger*
